body.p:
menu editoropen on menuTo edit menu resource methods in the Menu Editor, use the Menu → Load... command.
In the Load from Class dialog, specify the name of an application model.
Either click OK or use the <Select> button to click in the Selector: view. A list of selectors will appear that you can choose from.
Choose a particular menu and click OK. The menu will be loaded into the Menu Editor.
To edit menu resource methods starting in the Resource Finder , browse to a specific method and use the Edit command.
To edit a menu that has been applied to a widget, use the Menu → Read command.

topic.title: Install a menu bar on a canvas

body.p:
GUI developmentinstall menu in canvasmenuinstall in canvasUse Menu → Apply... to install the menu as a menu bar on the currently active canvas. To enable the Menu → Apply... command:
The menu being applied must be fully hierarchical. Use Edit → New Item and Edit → New Submenu Item to build the menu hierarchy.
Set the Menu Bar property for the canvas (click on the Properties button in the Canvas Tool, enable Menu Bar on the Basics page, and then select Apply & Close.)
Select Menu → Apply... in the Menu Editor. A dialog will prompt to confirm and/or supply the class and selector for the menu bar resource method.

menu editorcreate itemUse the Menu Editor’s Edit → New Item to create a new item at the top level of the menu. To create a new item at a sub-level, select the desired level before clicking Edit → New Item.

In the right-hand view of the Menu Editor, select the Basic properties page. Use the Label property to specify the text of the menu item, and the Value property to specify the method that performs the menu item’s action.
Use Edit → New Submenu Item to create a new sub-menu item. The new item will be created in a level below the currently selected element (if any).
In the right-hand view of the Menu Editor, select the Basic properties page. Use the Value property to specify the name of the method in the application model that performs the menu item’s action.
body.note: The Menu Editor does not support the use of BlockClosures as menu actions; to use these, you must modify the action methods manually.

body.p:
menu editoradd shortcutUse the Menu Editor to edit the menu properties to add a keyboard shortcut:
Select the menu item in the left-hand view. In the right-hand view, click on Details with the <Select> button.
Specify the Shortcut character on the Details page.
To invoke the keyboard shortcut, press and hold the <Alt> key while pressing the shortcut character.

Alternately, use the "&" character in the Label field on the Basic properties page. The character in the menu label that is preceded by an "&" character will function as a mnemonic key; e.g., entering &cut in the label field will set "c" as the shortcut key for that item.

menu editoradd graphic to itemTo add a graphical image to a menu item, use the Menu Editor to edit the menu properties:
Select the menu item in the left-hand view. In the right-hand view, click on Details with the <Select> button.
Specify the name of the class and resource method in the Label image files on the Details page. The label image resource may be created and installed using the Image Editor.

topic.title: Set a toggle switch for a menu item

body.p:
menumake toggleEdit the properties for a menu item to enable and disable it programmatically:
Select the menu item in the left-hand view. In the right-hand view, click on Defaults with the <Select> button.
Set the On/Off indicator property to control whether a check box appears next to the name of the menu item. Set the Initially enabled property to control the initial state of the menu item. Use Initially hidden to visually remove the menu item.
